rationale: 'shot up' describes prices (background condition), not the virus's impact on cases/deaths/etc.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.

rationale: The phrase 'had shot up 28 per cent' uses a vivid verb ('shot up') to describe price increase (direct impact).
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.
